title: 27-year-old refugee Ludmyla Chyrkova is heading home
description: 27-year-old Ludmyla Chyrkova struggled with her decision since leaving on the second day of the war.

title: Ros Atkins on… PM’s lockdown party fine
description: Boris Johnson has been fined for attending a birthday party, thrown for him during a Covid lockdown.

description: Watch highlights of England's 5-0 World Cup qualifying win over Northern Ireland in Belfast, where Lauren Hemp and Georgia Stanway both score twice for the Lionesses.

description: Troops head to the Donbas in preparation for fresh battle and Ukraine averts a cyber-attack on its energy grid

title: Partygate fines: Are Boris Johnson and Rishi Sunak finished?
description: The prime minister and chancellor are in uncharted waters over fines for breaking lockdown laws.

title: Energy bills: Denbigh venue cancels winter weddings due to costs
description: One venue's owners say they cannot host winter weddings, as their heating bills are too high.

title: Holy grail of WW2 watches sells for £12,000
description: The watch sat in a drawer for decades until its owner saw an edition of the BBC's Antiques Roadshow.

title: Ukraine conflict: How will we know if Russia used chemical weapons?
description: If Russia used non-conventional weapons in Mariupol, it would have crossed a red line with the West.

title: Grieving Russians can't believe talk of war crimes in Ukraine

title: Why do so few rape cases go to court?
description: The number of reported rapes making it to court in England and Wales has continued to decline.

description: Preview followed by live coverage of Wednesday's Champions League game between Liverpool and Benfica.

title: Marks & Spencer: Flagship Oxford Street store to be demolished
description: Sadiq Khan won't intervene in plans to bulldoze the Art Deco building, despite environmental fears.

title: Multiple people shot in New York City subway
description: At least 13 people have been shot in an incident during morning rush hour in Brooklyn.

description: Kemarni Watson Darby suffered weeks of beatings before the fatal attack at his West Bromwich home.

title: Warning travel problems could continue into summer
description: Border force is "chronically under-staffed" and it will take time to train new officers, a union says.

title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard: Opening arguments in US trial against ex-wife
description: Elon Musk and James Franco will take the stand at a celebrity trial that is being broadcast live.

title: Turner Prize 2022: Trafalgar Square whipped cream artist among nominees
description: Heather Phillipson, who put a whipped cream sculpture on the Fourth Plinth, is among the nominees.

title: Ex-minister apologises for defending sex offender MP

description: Derby County's prospective new owner Chris Kirchner indicates Wayne Rooney will stay in charge of the club next season.

description: Speaking at a Russian space centre, Mr Putin claimed his invasion aimed to help people in the Donbas.

title: Kinahan Cartel: US sanctions cartel leader with links to Tyson Fury
description: US officials said Daniel Kinahan, who worked as an advisor to boxer Tyson Fury, leads one of Europe's top drug gangs.

title: Marine Le Pen says she opposes sanctions on Russian gas
description: The French presidential candidate says she is in favour of sanctions on Russia - except for energy.

title: Biggest squeeze for public sector pay in 20 years
description: The spending power of an average public sector salary has seen its biggest drop on record.

description: Reverend Steve Tinning pays tribute to the Southend West MP murdered last year.

title: 2+2 talks: How India and US agreed to differ on Ukraine war
description: The countries showed willingness to understand their differing stands on Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Erriyon Knighton on Tokyo, Oregon, Paris and beyond
description: But for the pandemic, Erriyon Knighton might be wearing shoulder pads rather than spikes. Now, he is one of track's brightest stars.

description: BBC Sport looks at Karim Benzema's prolific form for Real Madrid and how he has emerged as one of Europe's top strikers.

description: Erik ten Hag is a football obsessive but his background means Manchester United might need him more than he needs them.

title: Golf: Blind players tee up for Droitwich matchplay challenge

title: The 60-foot-long bridge stolen in India
